messages.title: Parents' anger over planned £5m school cuts in the Five Towns
messages.content: Up to 150 teachers at risk from Tory plans. Thousands of local parents have joined Yvette Cooper's campaign against further 'immoral' Tory school cuts in Normanton, Pontefract, Castleford and Knottingley.

messages.title: Yvette's question leaves PM red faced

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposition to the planned £5m school cuts and dedication to fighting the cuts to protect local education and jobs of teachers.
Calls for a good Brexit deal for the Five Towns; focus on getting a fair manufacturing deal, agriculture supports, and protection of workers' rights and jobs.

issues.brexitEurope: Yvette calls for good Brexit deal for Five Towns.
issues.economy: Manufacturing and industry: Yvette is calling for a good deal for our manufacturing industry in the Brexit deal.
issues.education: Up to 150 teachers at risk from Tory plans for education budget cuts.

endorsements.endorser: Why Castleford Tigers boss is backing Yvette

images.caption: Yvette with parents & pupils outside Wheldon Road School.
